results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-7956f48bc9-tbwb6], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the specified pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod mysql-7956f48bc9-tbwb6`.
3. Look for readiness probe issues.
4. Fix configuration or resource issues.
5. Restart pod if needed.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-5bfc5cbf6f-54hm5], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the expected pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod wordpress-5bfc5cbf6f-54hm5`.
3. Look for readiness probe issues or errors.
4. Fix any configuration or resource issues.
5. Restart the pod if needed.

results.name: default/wordpress-5bfc5cbf6f-54hm5
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.

results.name: default/mysql-7956f48bc9-tbwb6
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "mysql:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check Kubernetes node permissions.
5. Try a specific version tag instead of "latest".
